title: Nerdlinger (90s Skate Punk) - Australian
description:
CONTAINS THE BACK TO WINNIPEG EP & CHURCH OF PUNK ROCK SINGLE

You may have seen Nerdlinger on stage across Australia with 28 Days, Calling All Cars, Frenzal Rhomb, Guttermouth, Me First & The Gimmie Gimmies, MXPX, or at any of their 60 odd 2013 shows with countless local and international bands.

You may have heard NerdlingerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s debut EP Ã¢â‚¬ËœBack To WinnipegÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ on Stu HarveyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Short Fast LoudÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ on JJJ and on numerous other punk rock shows across the country, or listened to Ã¢â‚¬ËœNever On Schedule, Always On TimeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ on Sector9 / GoPro Video of the Day Ã¢â‚¬ËœTurkey Slide JamÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ which went viral in September 2012.

You may have complained to police that Nerdlinger are on your property, drinking your booze and courting your daughters and wives.

You may have witnessed the boys from Nerdlinger being the driving force behind an Australian Tribute album to the Late Tony Sly (No Use for a Name). They organized 20 punk bands from around the country to record acoustic covers of Ã¢â‚¬Å“No Use for a NameÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ songs including bands such as Ã¢â‚¬Å“The DeclineÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and Ã¢â‚¬Å“Friends with the EnemyÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½. The album is titled Ã¢â‚¬Å“When it Ends it Begins with YouÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and is available through Band Camp. All proceeds go to the Tony Sly Foundation.
This June / July Nerdlinger will celebrate the release of their new single Ã¢â‚¬ËœChurch Of Punk RockÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ by teaming up with Canberra band Ã¢â‚¬Å“RevellersÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and will travel coast to coast on the Ã¢â‚¬Å“Friends with BenefitsÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ National Tour. Singer and guitarist Josh Arentz will also play an acoustic set at SydneyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Ã¢â‚¬ËœHitÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s & PitsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ festival.

The lads are currently hard at work with producer Daniel Antix at Lockup Studios in Sutherland recording their debut album and learning Japanese for their Japanese September tour.
